item.content:encoded:
Hail thou attire of monsoon,

Thy rhyme of restless rhapsodic tune,

Thy holy flair deluding Ahilya,

By carol of the pearls hymning Indra.

What sonneteer to pen down thee,

What thy ode, what poesy?

Here I sing thy unsung praise,

In ‘manly-tuned’ glorious ways.

Homecoming of thine incarnated overcast,

Crawling empyrean floor like a toddler surpassed,

Screening the age of hoary sky,

Like a young one gladdening grandpa by.

Then, in the sway of tyrannical wind,

Thou slant off the course vertically, grimmed,

Like a youth ‘enslaved’ by envious greed,

Sheerly  living as ‘master’ of breed.

‘Tis not the end, not a frail thou art,

As thunders & flashes happen to start,

What were droplets, art now hail,

No tyranny can hast them sail.

Thy eerie tempest o’er us, harass,

And tame that wind as hours pass,

Likewise for a man, passes years,

Truns he, bold & potent without fear.

Drizzle thou slowly farewell the skyway, Like a wise old man passes away.

item.content:encoded:
A creak masks the silence

of solitude and head,

When the poet comforts himself

In an olden wooden bed.

Wordings laden ladder of

Stupor which ends swirling,

 He sinks down there,

Makes sentences of his feeling.

With the brush of a quill

He paints his thoughtful mind,

With most colourful words

On the canvas of parchment aligned.

“Oh! Men and women,

Naive critics of the world,

Shall do praise wordless colours

But not colourful words?

Like an alluringly painted canvas,

 Are poetic words in a yellow hue,

Standing alone untouched Waiting for literates to walk through.”

item.content:encoded:
Fishing near the edge

of lake with glimmering water,

and a goose goofing around

in loose muddy shimmering platter.

Water lilies laid in the lap of lake,

embracing the watery surface,

where shall, crickets concert at night

echoing up the silent space.

Beyond the lake, I could see

immortal ‘the art’, I kept wondering

a blue hill trying to catch the clouds,

as nature, ‘the artist’ kept prospering.

The next moment, got seized by a bird,

sprung from the lake, it flew to the sky

along the aisle where hill met the clouds,

I amazed how fake could daydreams be

and unfolded the truths of nature we see.

Branded by gods & bounded by country

that didn’t ‘the artist’ nature do,

leaving ‘the art’ immortal no more,

humans ‘the masterpiece’ ruined it too.

item.content:encoded:
Rainbow coloured wings, alike

soaked in painter’s painting palatte

little beautiful butterflies

on bush of roses beside the lake

I paused to name it, ‘the butterfly bush’.

Lovely petals with flies around

and rainbow wings on rose background

both added beauty to each

both attracted to beauty of each.

Dazzling dews on rosy reds

aroused a fly to fly around

that is what, the work of lust

it flew past down, near the ground.

Got hit in a thorn,

bush was ugly after moment

it flew away so far,

lustful love ain’t so potent.

Prestigious flower of love

The rose still remains the same

whether we take it as it is

accepted by true lovers and dame,

possess heavenly integrity

has its own beloved fame

it ain’t no Butterfly Bush but a ‘red rose bush’, it’s name.
